title: 112_s3252
content:
There are no paragraphs provided in the prev_chunk, so we will focus on summarizing the curr_chunk:

"SECTION 1. FINDINGS."

Summarized: Section 1 presents the findings. Congress finds that Jack Nicklaus is a world-famous golf professional with 120 victories in professional competition, including 18 major championships, making him a legendary figure in golf history. Jack Nicklaus is a legendary golfer with numerous achievements, including winning each major championship at least 3 times and holding the record for most senior major championships. He is known for his magnetic personality and has received numerous athletic honors, such as being named Individual Male Athlete of the Century by Sports Illustrated. Jack Nicklaus has received various honors in the world of sports, including the Legend Award, ESPY Lifetime Achievement Award, Vince Lombardi Award of Excellence, and PGA Player of the Year Award. He was also inducted into the World Golf Hall of Fame at 34. Outside of sports, he has received several golf industry awards for his work as a golf course designer, such as the Old Tom Morris Award, Donald Ross Award, and Don A. Rossi Award. Golf Inc. magazine named him the Most Powerful Person in Golf for a record 6 times. Jack Nicklaus, named the Most Powerful Person in Golf for 6 consecutive years, is involved in designing over 290 golf courses globally through Nicklaus Design. He served as Global Ambassador for including golf in the Olympics and received the Presidential Medal of Freedom in 2005. Jack Nicklaus, recipient of the Presidential Medal of Freedom in 2005, is dedicated to charitable causes like the Nicklaus Children's Health Care Foundation, raising over $21 million in 6 years. He supports junior golf initiatives and has worked with the PGA of America Junior Golf Foundation for 4 decades. Jack Nicklaus manages the Memorial Tournament in Ohio, raising over $5.7 million for Nationwide Children's Hospital since 1976. He also supports various charitable causes like spinal-cord research, pancreatic cancer, and Florida Everglades restoration. Jack Nicklaus and his wife are involved in the Nicklaus Children's Health Care Foundation in Florida, providing health assistance to over 4,000 children and families through various programs. They announced the opening of the Miami Children's Hospital Nicklaus Outpatient Center. Children's Hospital Nicklaus Outpatient Center in Palm Beach County offers pediatric urgent care, diagnostic, and rehabilitation services. Jack Nicklaus established "The Jake" golf tournament as a fundraiser for the Nicklaus Children's Health Care Foundation, raising over $3,000,000. He also serves as an honorary chair at the American Lake Veterans Golf Course in Tacoma, designed for wounded and disabled veterans' rehabilitation. Jack Nicklaus has donated his design services for the improvement of the American Lake Veterans Golf Course in Tacoma, which is designed solely for disabled veterans. The course served over 37,000 veterans and their families in 2011, using golf for rehabilitation. Nicklaus also supports the First Tee program, bringing golf to children and teaching them valuable skills. Jack Nicklaus remains active in tournament golf, consulting with the PGA Tour and having over 95 Nicklaus courses host a total of 650 professional tournaments. In 2011 alone, his courses hosted 15 PGA Tour-sanctioned events. Jack Nicklaus will be awarded a Congressional Gold Medal for promoting excellence and good sportsmanship. The medal will be designed and struck by the Secretary of the Treasury. Additionally, duplicate medals will be made. The Secretary of the Treasury may strike duplicate bronze medals of the gold medal and sell them to cover costs. The medals are considered national medals. Funding for the medals is authorized through the United States Mint Public Enterprise Fund.
